transcript.text: shabbat shalom this is daniel lee with
torah restoration ministries it's july
9th the morning of july nine 2016 of
course Shabbat began last night friday
night goes all the way till tonight
saturday night it's the fifth day of the
fourth month and it's the 14th Shabbat
since the shemitah year began which I
just find that incredible it's already
the 14th Shabbat since the shemitah year
began back in in early April I wanted to
start off just by reading psalm for the
Sabbath day this is specifically created
by David for the Shabbat Psalm 92 a song
or song for the Shabbat it is a good
thing to give thanks unto yahweh and
this thing praises under your name
almost high to show forth your loving
kindness in the morning and your
faithfulness every night upon an
instrument of ten strings and upon the
sultry upon the heart with a solemn
sound for thou Yahweh has made me glad
through your work and I will triumph in
the works of your hands Oh Yahweh how
greater your works and your thoughts are
very deep a brutish man knoweth not
neither does a fool understand this when
the wicked spring is the grass and when
all the workers of iniquity to flourish
it is that they shall be destroyed
forever but thou Yahweh are most high
for evermore for low your enemies or
Yahweh for low your enemies shall perish
and all the workers of iniquity shall be
scattered but my horn shall you exalt at
the horn of a unicorn I shall be
anointed with fresh oil mine I also
shall see my desire on mine enemies and
mine ears shall hear my desire of the
wicked that rise up against me the
righteous shall flourish like the palm
tree he shall grow like a cedar and
Lebanon and those that be planted in the
house of Yahweh shall flourish in the
courts of our Elohim they shall still
bring forth fruit and old age they shall
be fat and flourishing to show that
Yahweh is upright he is my rock and
there is no unrighteousness in him
hallelujah it's always a good thing to
read on the shabbat so man last shabbat
when Jerry and I went out preaching it
was unlike a preaching I've ever
experienced just because the reaction
was so positive and I mean usually the
reaction is is typically negative and
you get people who are upset and
everything but there was just a real
sobriety and conviction of the Spirit
Jerry was able to share his testimony in
depth with with a lady who approached us
after the preaching was over sharing
details of how he escaped the communist
Poland back in nineteen eighty four and
how yah was with him and it was just it
was just an incredible credible time of
preaching I know Jerry he just had these
tears coming down his eyes at one point
as he was warning warning the people of
this nation that you know we need to
repent we need to turn back to him in
order to avoid the judgment to come
there's a lot of crazy things going on
in the world right now and the verse
that just keeps coming to my mind over
and over and over and over again and
it's a verse that I think most people
are pretty familiar with but it's in
Romans and it's romans 8 28 romans 8 28
and it says and we know that all things
work together for good to them that love
yah and to them who are called according
to his purpose love
we love ya and we love our neighbor when
love is the the hallmark and the the
center of our life charity the very
center of what Torah is because Yahshua
is he is love he is love love not in the
way that you know our culture defines it
today which is sort of a selfish
fuzzy-wuzzy you know let's tell her
everything tied to love but I love that
seeks to please him and Revelation it
says that all things are created for his
pleasure I love that seeks to walk in
the commandments walk in his word a love
that can only come by being covered in
his blood you know to set us free from
our past transgressions a love that can
only come through the indwelling of his
spirit I'm walking in his spirit and the
gifts of his spirit but it's his love
and when we love him all things that are
going on in our lives and the things
that are going on around us they all
work for our good and you know I was
reflecting that last shabbat when Jerry
and I went preaching we you know at
first we weren't sure we were going to
go to Pioneer Square and we kind of
wandered around we thought that there's
this one concert going down at the
waterfront which wound up not happening
it we got some wrong information and we
kept wandering around wandering around
like wondering what what's going on here
and then because we wound up reaching
later than normal at Pioneer Square that
this amount of shade started creeping
over the square as we as we continue to
preach and we realize that it was
actually a good thing that we didn't
preach to later because the the shade
not only protected us from the Sun but
it drew people you know people were able
to sit down and congregate because they
weren't sitting in that hot Summer Sun
so it was just amazing how how y'all
work that out I'm so grateful so
grateful for this shabbat so grateful
the for a day of rest and rejoicing this
is going to be just a very short very
short Sabbath morning chat just because
I just wanted to highlight that love
charity well as long as we're loving him
and walking in his ways that all these
things all these things in our lives
work out for the good and I love that
about you I love how his burden is so
light his yoke is so easy because all we
have to do is love him love him allow
his love to penetrate every every part
of our life and and that of course helps
us to love others the way that we should
hallelujah oh this is daniel john lee
with tour restoration ministries may you
have a very wonderful blessed shabbat
shabbat shalom website spirit them Torah
calm
